metadata.dc:author: Pérez, M
Noda, M
Lugo, M
Pascual, L
metadata.dc:description: Systematic physical training influences upon a series of changes which occurs in the body, not only improves the cardiovascular functioning, but every organ and system, it increases the functional capacity of the individual, reduces tension due to stress and controls arterial tension figures. Regarding the aforementioned aspects, a study in 50 patients representing 100% of hypertensive subjects involved in a physical exercise program without any other associated disease is made with the aim of determining the influence of systematic physical activity upon the treatment of arterial hypertension. Results show that in most of the patients who previously had high tension values, hypertension was controlled or improved by systematic physical training and the use of drugs was also reduced or eliminated.
metadata.dc:title: El ejercicio físico. Resultado en los pacientes hipertensos de la circunscripción 30 del Policlínico Docente Lawton.
[Physical exercise. The results in hypertensive patients of area 30 of the Policlínico Docente Lawson].
